Gain an understanding of partial differential equations, including their formation and solution. 2. **Complex-Valued Functions** - Understand the concept of complex-valued functions and analytic functions. - Apply these concepts to solve real-life problems. --- 3. **Contour Integrals** - Learn the theory behind contour integrals. - Use contour integration formulas and techniques to solve problems. 4. **Residue Theory** - Employ residues to evaluate real integrals through complex integration. --- ## **Course Outcomes** Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to: 1. **Apply PDEs to Real-World Problems** - Formulate and solve partial differential equations relevant to various scientific and engineering fields. 2. **Analyze Complex-Valued Functions** - Demonstrate an understanding of complex-valued functions and their applications. - Utilize analytic functions to address practical problems. --- 3. **Perform Contour Integrals** - Execute contour integrals using the appropriate methods and theorems. - Apply contour integration techniques to solve complex integrals. 4. **Utilize Residue Theory** - Calculate residues and apply the residue theorem to evaluate real integrals. - Solve complex integration problems using residue theory. --- ## **Module 1: Partial Differential Equations (PDEs)** ### **Learning Outcomes** - Understand different types of PDEs and their classifications. - Formulate PDEs from physical scenarios and solve them using appropriate methods. ### **Overview** - **Introduction to PDEs** - Definition and examples of PDEs. - Difference between ordinary differential equations (ODEs) and PDEs. - **Types of PDEs** - Classification: elliptic, parabolic, and hyperbolic PDEs. - **Formation and Solution Methods** - How to formulate PDEs from real-world problems. - Common methods for solving PDEs: separation of variables, method of characteristics. - **Examples and Applications** - Heat equation, wave equation, and Laplace’s equation. - Physical interpretations and boundary conditions. --- ## **Module 2: Application of Partial Differential Equations** ### **Overview** - **Modeling with PDEs** - Real-world problems modeled by PDEs (e.g., diffusion, vibrations). - **Boundary and Initial Value Problems** - Solving PDEs with specific boundary and initial conditions. - **Numerical Methods** - Introduction to numerical solutions of PDEs (finite difference method, finite element method). - **Case Studies** - Analysis of case studies where PDEs are used to solve practical engineering and scientific problems. ### **Learning Outcomes** - Apply PDEs to model and solve real-world problems. - Understand and implement numerical methods for PDEs. --- ## **Module 3: Complex Variable – Differentiation** ### **Overview** - **Introduction to Complex Functions** - Definition of complex functions and their properties. - **Analytic Functions** - Definition and conditions for a function to be analytic. - Cauchy-Riemann equations and their significance. - **Differentiation in the Complex Plane** - Techniques for differentiating complex functions. - Examples of complex differentiable functions and their applications. ### **Learning Outcomes** - Understand the concept of complex differentiation. - Apply differentiation techniques to complex functions. --- ## **Module 4: Complex Variable – Integration** ### **Overview** - **Contour Integration** - Definition and basic concepts of contour integrals. - Fundamental Theorems: Cauchy’s Theorem, Cauchy’s Integral Formula. - **Evaluation of Contour Integrals** - Techniques for evaluating integrals around different contours. - **Applications** - Applications of contour integration in solving real-world problems. ### **Learning Outcomes** - Master the techniques for contour integration. - Apply integral theorems to solve problems involving complex functions. --- ## **Module 5: Complex Variable – Residue Integration** ### **Overview** - **Residue Theory** - Definition of residues and their computation. - **Residue Theorem** - Statement and proof of the Residue Theorem. - Applications of residue theory to evaluate integrals. - **Practical Examples** - Using residues to solve real integrals and analyze complex functions. ### **Learning Outcomes** - Understand and calculate residues for complex functions. - Apply residue theory to evaluate complex integrals. ---
